quest.name: The Wisdom of Allag
journal: G'raha Tia surveys his surroundings with an expectant glint in his eye.
objectives: Find a point of stagnant lightning and defeat the lightning sprites that appear.
Examine the point of stagnant lightning and obtain a concentrated lightning shard.
Deliver the concentrated lightning shard to G'raha Tia.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So this is where you had your reckoning with Thordan. I wish I'd been with you.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: This appears to be Helix, which means we stand in the Alpha Quadrant. To the east lies the Beta Quadrant, and...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Yes, I believe I have my bearings. Though this is my first time on Azys Lla, I do have some familiarity with the place thanks to the records in the Crystal Tower.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Unless I am mistaken, this path leads to an aetheryte, beyond which there will be an information terminal. I suggest we begin our search there.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Time for our authority on Allagan artifacts to show what he can do.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: And here is the terminal. A moment while I search the archives for references to tempering...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Ah, there we are...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: “Eikonic Corruption ─ An Overview”... That sounds promising!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Indeed. Let us see what this report has to say.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Hm? ...Confound it. The contents appear to have been deleted.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What? No...! Isn't there something you can do?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Not from here, I'm afraid. But it may be that another copy of the report exists elsewhere. The question is, where to look...?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It says here the report was written by someone named Owen. Is it likely that he kept a copy?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I would say it is a distinct possibility. Assuming he was a researcher here, he will have had quarters on the Habisphere. We can ascertain the details at Habisphere Control.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Let us return to the Bonanza and avail ourselves of the manacutters. We will need them to reach our destination.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I forgot─you already have a suitable means of transport, don't you. No need to waste time accompanying us back to the ship, then. We'll see you at the Habisphere.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The manacutters appear to be Ironworks made, but I daresay Tataru will craft her own soon enough.

dialogue.name: HABISPHERESYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bzzz... Welcome to Habisphere Control. How may I assist you?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If the late Owen did indeed have a chamber here, this node will be able to tell us its number.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text:
There. From what I recall of the layout, it should be somewhere in the vicinity of─
...Hm?

dialogue.name: HABISPHERESYSTEM
dialogue.text: Warning: an evacuation order is presently in effect. Entry to the Habisphere is not permitted at this time.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Foiled again... In all likelihood, the order would have been imposed during the Fourth Umbral Calamity, and I doubt it will be lifted in the near future.

dialogue.name: HABISPHERESYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bzzz... Energy level critical. Returning to base for recharging.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well...surely there must be some other way to gain access. Force, for example?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Hm. Ere we resort to that, I have an idea. Were we to send a surge of energy through yonder control mechanism, it should prompt the system to restart, releasing the locks.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: As for a suitable energy source...a concentrated lightning shard might suffice. Happily, I seem to recall that they are known to form at points of stagnant aether throughout the continent.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You seem to recall? Are you honestly telling me that was in the records too?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Hah! I am. A report sent to the capital mentioned that lightning-aspected aether was prone to pooling on the continent, resulting in surges that interfered with equipment.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: A minor detail, I grant you, but in my role as caretaker of the Crystal Tower, there was no such thing as too much Allagan knowledge.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Besides, my studies helped me to feel connected to the Source. To home.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I must have explored this facility a thousand times in my mind, but to finally stand here with the two of you... 'Tis more exhilarating than I can well express.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Now then, the lightning shard. If I may, I suggest we split up and search the Beta Quadrant. Oh, but beware of sprites─they are wont to manifest where the aether is stagnant.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Now you're just showing off. Which makes me think we should make a contest of this. The first to return here with a shard wins. What do you say?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Very well! It would be my honor to come third!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: (-Disembodied Voice-)Bravo! That was quite a show, adventurer! Why, the spectacle proved so enthralling that all thoughts of the prize slipped my mind.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: (-Disembodied Voice-)I appear to have forfeited our little race! Congratulations─the lightning shard is yours.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Who are you? Show yourself at once!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: What, no dramatic entrance? You've changed.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Very funny. Now let's get back to work.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Forgive me, my friend. The scene so reminded me of our first meeting, I couldn't resist.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Ugh, you remember that? In my defense, I was caught up in the moment. It isn't every day you meet an honest-to-gods hero, after all.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Forgive me. The scene so reminded me of our first meeting, I couldn't resist.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text:
Well, the contest continues, so you had better hurry back.
...Ah, but one last thing.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. For bringing me here.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You have a shard? Then you win. I searched high and low, but couldn't find so much as a trace of stagnant aether.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: It appears Alisaie had no luck, so victory is yours. Congratulations. Now then, may I have the shard?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: <sigh> What is it that makes you so much better at finding things? What do you have that I don't?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: That is a question I too have asked myself on numerous occasions. I suspect we could both learn a great deal from Forename─and not only about the secrets of adventuring. But come, we should attend to our mission.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Excellent, the system responded exactly as intended. We now have access to the Habisphere.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Only one obstacle remains: the security systems within. Should they be triggered, they could make life rather difficult for us.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: In light of which, pray leave the rest to me. If I am right, my royal blood should allow me to venture in unmolested.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Assuming this place works like the Crystal Tower, yes. But if it doesn't, you'll be on your own. I want you to promise us that you'll get out at the first sign of trouble.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I promise. Wish me luck!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, nothing for it but to sit tight...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm sure this Owen fellow was very learned, but “Eikonic Corruption ─ An Overview” sounds like a Studium thesis. We all had to write one.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Lest you wonder, mine was about the combat applications of aether. I'm nothing if not practical...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Alphinaud's was more philosophical, of course. Political, dare I say it. He chose to write a lengthy discourse on our nation's duty to the world.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: A controversial subject, to say the least.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: He asserted that Sharlayan's knowledge should rightly be used to protect all life on the star─in direct opposition to the country's cherished policy of nonintervention. Being a leading member of the Forum, our father was...not happy.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: At the time, of course, Alphinaud was utterly convinced of his views and would cheerfully argue to the death with anyone who saw things differently. By which I mean, the rows were long. To be fair to him, though, he's since learned to be a little more open-minded─but deep down he still holds fast to that one belief. And I admire him for it.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I should have liked to meet the young Alphinaud! For what it's worth, my thesis concerned the Allagan civilization as depicted in folklore.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Oh, you're back. I didn't know you attended the Studium?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I didn't─a thesis was required to earn my Archon's mark. My peers at the Students of Baldesion convinced me to write one with the promise of unfettered access to forbidden tomes!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Though I considered it no more than a means to an end at the time, I will admit it was gratifying to have my efforts acknowledged.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Good gods, an Archon's thesis... I shudder to imagine the work involved. But enough about that─is this the fruit of your foray?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Yes. Owen's archive node. It was waiting for me in his chamber.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If a copy of his report still survives, it would be stored in this device. Shall we find out?

dialogue.name: DATASYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Initializing... Scanning for registered user...

dialogue.name: DATASYSTEM
dialogue.text: User not found. To proceed as a guest, please complete biometric authentication.

dialogue.name: DATASYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Verifying...

dialogue.name: DATASYSTEM
dialogue.text: <bloop> Authentication complete. Guest identified as: member of the royal family. I am at your most humble service, Your Highness.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Hm hm hm! It never ceases to amuse me. 'Tis but a pity the effect will not last forever.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Doga and Unei said as much when they granted me this gift. But until such time as it fades, I shall use it gratefully.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Search archive for “Eikonic Corruption.”

dialogue.name: DATASYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<blip> Searching...
<bloop> One item found: Eikonic Corruption ─ An Overview.

dialogue.name: DATASYSTEM
dialogue.text: The report is locked by the author. Please state password.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, go on then, Your Highness. Tell the nice node the password.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The, uh... Right! Let's see...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Glory be to Allag!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Long live Emperor Xande!

dialogue.name: DATASYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> <bloop> Password incorrect. Please try again.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Confound it!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Come now, passwords are invariably short and simple. For instance...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Password!

dialogue.name: DATASYSTEM
dialogue.text: The notion that the password could be something so inane would be laughable were it not dangerously stupid. Furthermore, your conduct in the presence of His Highness is grossly inappropriate. Know your place, handmaiden.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What did that thing just call me!?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Wild rose!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Courage!

dialogue.name: DATASYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> <bloop> Password incorrect. Again. Be warned that any further inappropriate behavior in the presence of His Highness will not be tolerated.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: All right, that's it. I say we dismantle it and manually extract what we need.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Now, now, let's not be too hasty! A single misstep, and we risk losing the report altogether.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I believe this may be a task for Cid and his colleagues. If anyone can coax machina into cooperating, it is them.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Come, let us bear the node back to the Rising Stones.
